page.title: 04BATHGATE'S MUSEUM
page.content: In 1984 Mr. Millan took an interest in building Bathgate a Museum. When the museum was under way Mr. Millan paid us a visit as he used to be a pupil here and then a teacher, but now he is an Assistant Headteacher at Redhouse, Blackburn. When he came he showed us some of the objects that he had in the museum, which he had found or which people had donated. The objects which distinctly stick in my mind are a pair of old spectacles and some lovely shaped bottles. Now, one year later, the museum is coming on well and more objects have been donated. This museum gives Bathgate another piece of interest and we are very grateful to Mr. Millan for planning and building the museum that belongs to Bathgate.
